intro: Hieracium balansae, commonly known as the Balansae hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine habitats, where it thrives in well-drained soils. Its yellowish flowers are small and clustered, and it produces numerous seeds that are dispersed by the wind. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and vulnerable species.
